description.p: The pulse of life beats fast in dark, winding city streets all across Avestros. Millions of lives crammed into ramshackle homes and united in poverty— the city is a breeding ground for desperation and disease. However, in some districts, there are streets where none fall ill— areas of respite where the plague doctors operate.

These holy physicians are masters of medicine, running clinics across the nation that save countless lives. Some roam, following the grim footsteps of plague and curing those afflicted in its wake, others are conscripted in the nation’s army, combating the infection and sickness that runs deadly in war. Many also work as midwives, educators, and city planners.
They use their divine powers to combat the invisible, bacterial horrors of the world, with gods such as Asclepius, Dian Cécht, Sekhmet, Serket, and Eir common among those worshiped by such clerics.
Although loved and respected for their great powers of healing, many are wary of the plague doctors, for one with the power to battle necrosis and poison also has the power to wield it.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Plague Doctor Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
You have proficiency with martial weapons and in the Medicine skill, and you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the poisoned condition.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the poisoned condition.

description.p: Your magic can manipulate the humors of the body, causing healing or harm. Once on your turn, you can use one of the following effects:

Respite. When you cast a spell or use an item that restores hit points to one or more creatures, choose one target of that spell or item. That creature is also cured of one of the following conditions: blinded, charmed, deafened, or poisoned.

Necrosis. When you damage one or more creatures with a levelled spell or weapon attack, choose one creature damaged by that spell or attack. That creature takes an additional 1d4 necrotic damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of its next turn. The damage dealt by this feature increases by 1d4 at levels 5 (2d4), 11 (3d4), and 17 (4d4).

description.p: You can use your Channel Divinity to create a sanctuary of purity and asepsis for those you choose.

As a bonus action, you present your holy symbol, and a sphere of cool, blue light emanates from you. The sphere is centered on you, has a 30-foot radius, and shines dim light. The sphere moves with you, and it lasts for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated or die. Creatures of your choice in the sphere gain the following benefits:

ul.li: It has immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
If it is suffering from a nonmagical illness, the symptoms of that illness are repressed.
It can add 1d6 to saving throws made to resist or end the blinded, charmed, deafened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions.

description.p: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
